etymologies: Old English sunu, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zoon and German Sohn, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek huios

definitions: a boy or man in relation to either or both of his parents.
shortDefinitions: boy or man in relation to either or both of his parents

definitions: a male offspring of an animal.
(in Christian belief) the second person of the Trinity; Christ.
shortDefinitions: (in Christian belief) second person of Trinity

definitions: a man considered in relation to his native country or area

examples.text: one of Norfolk's most famous sons

shortDefinitions: man considered in relation to his native country or area

definitions: a man regarded as the product of a particular person, influence, or environment
shortDefinitions: man regarded as product of particular person or environment

definitions: used by an older person as a form of address for a boy or young man
shortDefinitions: used by older person as form of address for boy
